skill.name: flowio
skill.description: Parse FCS (Flow Cytometry Standard) files v2.0-3.1. Extract events as NumPy arrays, read metadata/channels, convert to CSV/DataFrame, for flow cytometry data preprocessing.
skill.summary: Parse FCS (Flow Cytometry Standard) files v2.0-3.1. Extract events as NumPy arrays, read metadata/ch...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing usage guides for the FlowIO Python library. No executable code, network requests, or file system access beyond reading its own documentation files. The skill is a guide for installing and using an external library for scientific data processing.

content.value_statement: Flow cytometry generates large FCS files that require specialized parsing. This skill provides complete guidance for reading FCS files, extracting event data as NumPy arrays, and converting data to CSV or DataFrame formats for analysis.
actual_capabilities: Read FCS files v2.0-3.1 and extract metadata
Convert event data to NumPy arrays
Create new FCS files from NumPy data
Export flow cytometry data to CSV or pandas DataFrame
Parse channel information and acquisition metadata
limitations: Does not perform advanced analysis like compensation or gating
Requires Python 3.9 or later with flowio library installed
Cannot modify FCS files in place - must recreate with create_fcs()
Does not support FlowJo or GatingML file formats

use_cases.title: Inspect flow cytometry files
use_cases.description: Quickly examine FCS file structure, channel names, event counts, and acquisition metadata before analysis.

use_cases.title: Convert FCS to CSV
use_cases.description: Transform flow cytometry event data from FCS binary format to CSV or pandas DataFrame for downstream pipelines.

use_cases.title: Batch process FCS files
use_cases.description: Process directories of FCS files, extract summary statistics, and prepare data for R or Python analysis workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Basic FCS reading
prompt_templates.prompt: Use FlowIO to read sample.fcs and show me the FCS version, event count, channel names, and acquisition date from the metadata.

prompt_templates.title: Extract event data
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all event data from experiment.fcs as a NumPy array and calculate the mean and standard deviation for each fluorescence channel.

prompt_templates.title: Convert to DataFrame
prompt_templates.prompt: Read the FCS file and convert the event data to a pandas DataFrame with proper column names, then save it to output.csv.

prompt_templates.title: Batch processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Process all .fcs files in the data directory. For each file, extract the filename, event count, channel count, and acquisition date. Return a summary table.

output_examples.input: Read myflow.fcs and show me the key information
output: Channel names: FSC-A, SSC-A, FL1-A (GFP), FL2-A (PE), FL3-A (APC), FL4-A (PerCP), Time, and 5 more

best_practices: Use only_text=True when you only need metadata, not event data, to save memory
Wrap file operations in try-except blocks to handle FCSParsingError gracefully
Use read_multiple_data_sets() for files containing more than one dataset
anti_patterns: Do not assume all FCS files have the same channel naming convention
Do not load large event arrays into memory if you only need metadata
Do not modify event data in place - extract, modify, then recreate with create_fcs()

faq.question: What Python version is required?
faq.answer: FlowIO requires Python 3.9 or later. Install with pip install flowio or uv pip install flowio.

faq.question: Does FlowIO support all FCS versions?
faq.answer: FlowIO supports FCS versions 2.0, 3.0, and 3.1, which cover the vast majority of files from modern instruments.

faq.question: How do I handle files with multiple datasets?
faq.answer: Use read_multiple_data_sets() function instead of FlowData constructor. This returns a list of FlowData instances, one per dataset.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using FlowIO?
faq.answer: FlowIO only reads and writes files you explicitly specify. It never sends data to external servers and has no network dependencies.

faq.question: Why am I getting offset errors?
faq.answer: Some FCS files have discrepancies between HEADER and TEXT section offsets. Use ignore_offset_discrepancy=True or ignore_offset_error=True parameters.

faq.question: How does FlowIO compare to FlowKit?
faq.answer: FlowIO handles file reading and writing. FlowKit adds advanced analysis like compensation, gating, and FlowJo support. They integrate well together.
